-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Tuesday, April 03, 2007 5:39 AM To: DMCA Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3735069O] Notice of Claimed Infringement - 040307-J8 ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Notice of Claimed Infringement - 040307-J8 Added by system at Tuesday, Apr 3 2007 10:38 am X-MailFrom: jsnyder@theesa.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; 3 Apr 2007 15:37:58 -0000 Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.101]) by DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 3 Apr 2007 10:37:58 -0500 Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 3 Apr 2007 10:37:58 -0500 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1175614671-7636-598-0 X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net Received: from dns1-alb.paetec.net (dns1-alb.paetec.net [64.80.0.162]) by mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id 90F2E7AC7C for ; Tue, 3 Apr 2007 10:37:57 -0500 (CDT) Received: from hook.theesa.COM (mail.theesa.com [63.138.80.34]) by dns1-alb.paetec.net (8.13.6/8.13.6) with ESMTP id l33FbcGA019543 for ; Tue, 3 Apr 2007 11:37:43 -0400 (EDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C77605.FF671A3A" X-ASG-Orig-Subj: Notice of Claimed Infringement - 040307-J8 Subject: Notice of Claimed Infringement - 040307-J8 Date: Tue, 3 Apr 2007 11:37:30 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Notice of Claimed Infringement - 040307-J8 thread-index: Acd1/MxzkS4paPGuS72K+m0DaTIIjgAADLOwAAFbG+AAAIGKYAAAQ9bQ X-Priority: 1 Priority: Urgent Importance: high From: "Jake Snyder" To: X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED Return-Path: jsnyder@theesa.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Apr 2007 15:37:58.0063 (UTC) FILETIME=[0E07EBF0:01C77606] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 USA Attention: Intellectual Property Enforcement Telephone: 202-223-2400 E-mail: dmcaresponse@theesa.com April 3, 2007 Dear Everyones Internet: The Entertainment Software Association ("ESA") is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as "ESA members"). ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein. The sale of circumvention devices, including modification chips, is actionable under federal law. The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S.C. § 1201) ( "DMCA") prohibits the manufacture, sale, import or offer to the public of any technology, product, service, device, component or part thereof that is designed to circumvent a technological measure that protects the right of a copyright owner or controls access to a work protected under federal copyright law. ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 66.98.160.96 (http://www.futura-online.com/) infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale circumvention devices. Specific URLs include but are not limited to: http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10843/name/wiinja+deluxe+-+wii+modchip/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10527/name/wiinja+v2+-+wii+modchip/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10634/name/wiinja+v2+-+wii+modchip+++wii+screwdriver/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10536/name/xeno+gc+-+modchip+gc/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10395/name/ewin2+pro+minisd+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++minisd+1gb/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10394/name/ewin2+microsd+%5Bwhite%5D+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++microsd+1gb/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10393/name/ewin2+microsd+%5Bblack%5D+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++microsd+1gb/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10389/name/m3+simply+ds+++microsd+1gb/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10388/name/microninja+ds+steel+blue+%5Bmicrosd%5D+++microsd+1gb/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10377/name/microninja+ds+steel+blue+%5Bmicrosd%5D/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10376/name/m3+simply+ds/ http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10224/name/smart+card+2+mini+sd+flash+linker+gba/nds/ The circumvention devices appearing on, or made available through, the through the above-listed IP address are listed and/or identified thereon by depiction, description, and/or name (the circumvention devices are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material.") Based on the information at its disposal, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. Accordingly, ESA hereby requests Everyones Internet to immediately do the following: 1. Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material. 2. Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. 3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein. Everyones Internet or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred. Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence. Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter. Sincerely, Intellectual Property Enforcement Entertainment Software Association ------------------------------- Jake Snyder Anti-Piracy Investigator Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 Phone: (202) 223-2400 x134 http://www.theESA.com jsnyder@theESA.com MIME element (text/html)

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004 USA

 

Attention:  Intellectual Property Enforcement

Telephone:  202-223-2400

E-mail:  dmcaresponse@theesa.com

 

April 3, 2007

Dear Everyones Internet:

The Entertainment Software Association (“ESA”) is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as “ESA members”).   ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein.

 

The sale of circumvention devices, including modification chips, is actionable under federal law.  The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S.C. § 1201) ( “DMCA”) prohibits the manufacture, sale, import or offer to the public of any technology, product, service, device, component or part thereof that is designed to circumvent a technological measure that protects the right of a copyright owner or controls access to a work protected under federal copyright law.

 

ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 66.98.160.96 (http://www.futura-online.com/) infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale circumvention devices.

 

Specific URLs include but are not limited to:

 

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10843/name/wiinja+deluxe+-+wii+modchip/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10527/name/wiinja+v2+-+wii+modchip/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10634/name/wiinja+v2+-+wii+modchip+++wii+screwdriver/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10536/name/xeno+gc+-+modchip+gc/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10395/name/ewin2+pro+minisd+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++minisd+1gb/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10394/name/ewin2+microsd+%5Bwhite%5D+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++microsd+1gb/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10393/name/ewin2+microsd+%5Bblack%5D+++ewin+pass+we+3+nds+++microsd+1gb/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10389/name/m3+simply+ds+++microsd+1gb/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10388/name/microninja+ds+steel+blue+%5Bmicrosd%5D+++microsd+1gb/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10377/name/microninja+ds+steel+blue+%5Bmicrosd%5D/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10376/name/m3+simply+ds/

http://www.futura-online.com/e-tienda/catalog/product_info.php/products_id/10224/name/smart+card+2+mini+sd+flash+linker+gba/nds/

 

The circumvention devices appearing on, or made available through, the through the above-listed IP address are listed and/or identified thereon by depiction, description, and/or name (the circumvention devices are hereinafter referred to as “Infringing Material.”)

 

Based on the information at its disposal, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. 

 

Accordingly, ESA hereby requests Everyones Internet to immediately do the following:

 

1.   Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material.
2.   Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above.
3.   Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms

      of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender.

 

ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein.  Everyones Internet or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred.  Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence.

 

Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter.

 

Sincerely,

 

Intellectual Property Enforcement

Entertainment Software Association

 

-------------------------------

 

Jake Snyder

Anti-Piracy Investigator

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004

Phone: (202) 223-2400 x134

http://www.theESA.com

jsnyder@theESA.com

 

MIME element (text/plain)
